isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3000FE, 3000RE - 3000FE LIGHT SYSTEMS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse F24 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At F24 and circuit 13H, measure voltage to ground.
Install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13H/13, then repair.
At body builder connector (169) and with transmission in reverse, measure voltage from cavity D, circuit 71A to ground.
Problem exists in body circuitry. Refer to body builders manual.
At body builder connector (169), install jumper from cavity D, circuit 71A to ground. Disconnect back-up light switch connector (41). At connector, measure resistance from circuit 71A to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 71A, or platform harness connector (2)/(2A), then repair.
At connector (41), measure voltage from circuit 71 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 71, or platform harness connector (2)/(2A), then repair.
At switch (41) and with transmission in reverse, measure resistance from black wire to white wire.
Remove jumper and reconnect (41). Back-up light switch circuitry checks good.
Remove fuses F14 and F15. Check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse(s).
At fuse F14, measure voltage from 14C/14 to ground.
Install fuses. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14C/14, then repair. Install fuses.
Remove headlight switch connector (23). Measure voltage from circuit 50A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50A, then repair.
At connector (23), measure voltage from circuit 50 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 50, then repair.
With headlight switch (23) in park position, measure resistance across terminals that were connected to circuits 50A and 62, and 50A and 58.
With headlight switch (23) in on position, measure resistance across terminals that were connected to circuits 50 and 51.
Reconnect connector (23) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With headlight switch in park or on position, measure voltage from cavity H, circuit 58 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169) and disconnect dimmer switch connector (27). With headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 51 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 51, then repair.
With dimmer switch (27) in the low beam position, measure resistance from green wire to blue wire.
With dimmer switch (27) in the high beam position, measure resistance from green wire to brown wire.
Reconnect (27) and disconnect body builder connector (170). With dimmer switch in low beam position and headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 53A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 53/53A, then repair.
With dimmer switch in high beam position and headlight switch on, measure voltage from circuit 52B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52/52B, then repair.
Reconnect (170) and disconnect dash connector (11). With headlight switch on and dimmer switch in high beam position, measure voltage from circuit 52A (cavity 4) to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 52A, then repair.
With switches still set, measure voltage from circuit 52A to 28-G (cavity 2).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G/ 11-GB/ 11-G or platform ground (J1), then repair.
Circuits to high beam indicator check good. Reconnect (11) and with switches still set, does indicator light work?
Replace bulb and socket. If the light still fails to work, replace instrument cluster.
Remove fuse F21 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
The following steps must be performed with the headlight switch on. At fuse F21, measure voltage from 62 to ground.
Re-install fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62, then repair. Re-install fuse.
Disconnect panel light switch connector (22). At harness connector, measure voltage from circuit 62 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62A, then repair.
At connector (22), measure voltage across circuit 62A to 62-GD.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GD/ 11-G, then repair.
Adjust switch (22) to bright position and measure resistance across pigtail blue wire to yellow wire.
Reconnect switch connector (22) and disconnect bussed connector (8). At circuit 62H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62H, then repair.
Reconnect connector (8) and disconnect body builder connector (169). At (169), measure voltage from circuit 62J to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62J, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169) and disconnect yellow dash connector (10). At harness connector (10), cavity 8, measure voltage from circuit 62B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62B, then repair.
At (10), measure voltage across cavity 8, circuit 62B to cavity 15, circuit 62-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GA/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to left cluster check good. Reconnect (10) and replace any lamps that fail to work. Do all lamps work?
Disconnect green dash connector (11). At harness connector (11), cavity 1, measure voltage from circuit 62C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62C, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across cavity 1, circuit 62C to cavity 11, circuit 62-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to center cluster check good. Reconnect (11) and replace any lamps that fail to work. Do all lamps work?
Disconnect natural colored dash connector (12). At (12), cavity 1, measure voltage from circuit 62D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62D, then repair.
At (12), measure voltage across cavity 1, circuit 62D to cavity 10, circuit 62-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GC/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to center cluster check good. Reconnect (12) and replace any lamps that fail to work. Do all lamps work?
Disconnect automatic transmission light connector (7) and measure voltage from circuit 62E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 62E, then repair.
At (7), measure voltage across circuit 62E to circuit 62-GE.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 62-GE/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
Automatic transmission light circuits check good. Reconnect connector (7). Does light operate?
Remove fuse F13 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse F13, measure voltage from 14A/14 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14A/14, then repair. Install fuse.
Remove flasher (1) and at socket, measure voltage from cavity B, circuit 55 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55, then repair.
At socket (1), install jumper from circuit 55 cavity B to 55A/60 cavity A. Move turn lever to left and right turn positions. Then push hazard switch. Do lights illuminate at each position?
Turn signal/ hazard lights illuminate in each position.
Disconnect turn signal harness connector (13). At platform connector, measure voltage from cavity C, circuit 55A/60 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 55A/60, then repair.
Move turn signal lever to left turn position. At turn signal connector (13), measure resistance from cavity C, circuit 55A/60 to cavity D, circuit 56, and to cavity E, circuit 56A.
(13), cav. C, 55A/60 to cav. D, 56 and cav. E, 56A.
Locate open in circuits 55A/60, 56 or 56A, then repair. If none found, replace turn signal.
Move turn signal lever to right turn position. At turn signal connector (13), measure resistance from cavity C, circuit 55A/60 to cavity F, circuit 57 and to cavity A, circuit 57A.
(13), cav. C, 55A/60 to cav. F, 57 and cav. A, 57A.
Locate open in circuit 57 or 57A, then repair. If none found, replace turn signal.
Push hazard switch and at (13), measure resistance from cavity C, circuit 55A/60 to all other circuits.
Reconnect (13) and disconnect body builder connector (170). With turn signal lever in the left turn position, measure voltage from cavity E, circuit 56A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56A, then repair.
With turn signal lever in the right turn position, at (170), measure voltage from cavity B, circuit 57A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57A, then repair.
Reconnect (170) and disconnect body builder connector (169). With turn signal lever in the left turn position, measure voltage from cavity F, circuit 56C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56C/56, then repair.
With turn signal lever in the right turn position, at (169), measure voltage from cavity G, circuit 57C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57C/57, then repair.
Reconnect connector (169). Does left turn signal indicator illuminate when lever is moved to the left turn position?
Disconnect green dash connector (11). With lever in left turn position, measure voltage from cavity 6, circuit 56B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56B, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across cavity 6, circuit 56B to cavity 2, circuit 28-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to left turn indicator check good. Reconnect (11) and with lever in left turn position, does indicator light illuminate?
Replace bulb and socket. If light still fails to illuminate, replace instrument cluster.
Does right turn signal indicator illuminate when lever is moved to the right turn position?
Disconnect green dash connector (11). With lever in right turn position, measure voltage from cavity 12, circuit 57B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57B, then repair.
At (11), measure voltage across cavity 12, circuit 57B to cavity 2, circuit 28-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 28-G/ 11-GB/ 11-G, then repair.
Circuits to right turn indicator check good. Reconnect (11) and with lever in right turn position, does indicator light illuminate?
Replace bulb and socket. If the light still fails to illuminate, replace instrument cluster.
Remove fuse F5 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F5, and at circuit 66F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66F, then repair.
Remove fuse F6 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F6, and at circuit 12B/12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12B/12, then repair.
Disconnect connector (224) and with headlight switch in headlight position and dimmer switch in dim position, at (224) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66C, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to high beam position and at connector (224) circuit 66E, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 66E, then repair.
Disconnect connector (165) and reconnect (224). With switches still set, at (165) measure voltage from circuit 66E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 66E, then repair.
Move dimmer switch to dim position and at connector (165) circuit 66C, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage circuit 66C, then repair.
At connector (165) and circuit 66-GA, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 66-GA, then repair.
Move key switch to accessories position and at connector (165) circuit 66, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 66, then repair.
Reconnect connector (165). DRL circuits check good.
